instructions.instruction: Colors in your kitchen, press "Next" to play.
Select milk, oven cleaner, water and lemon juice from the cupboard and press "Next".
Click to pour the lemon juice inside the red cabbage solution, then press "Next".
Red cabbage solution changes its color according to the pH value of the solution.
Click on the pH scale on the left to identify the pH value of the lemon juice then press "Next".
The pH value of lemon juice is 2. Thus, it is called an acid.
Click to pour the oven cleaner inside the red cabbage solution, then press "Next".
Click on the pH scale on the left to identify the pH value of the oven cleaner then press "Next".
The pH value of oven cleaner is 13. Thus, it is called an alkali.
Click to pour the water inside the red cabbage solution, then press "Next".
Click on the pH scale on the left to identify the pH value of the water then press "Next".
The pH value of water is 7. Thus, it is neutral.
Click to pour the milk inside the red cabbage solution, then press "Next".
Click on the pH scale on the left to identify the pH value of the milk then press "Next".
The pH value of milk is 6. Thus, it is acid.
The pH of lemon juice is lower than the pH of milk, therefore lemon juice is the stronger acid
